name: two twisted headbands
notes:
this pattern covers two different headband styles with a simple and stylish twist.

the first headband style is knit in double stockinette stitch, which yields a double-layer of stockinette stitch.

the resulting fabric is extra warm, and unlike regular stockinette stitch, it doesn’t curl!

the second headband style is a classic fisherman’s rib. this stitch is super stretchy and looks wonderful knit into a headband.

the accompanying tutorial video teaches you how to knit these two headbands from beginning to end. it includes tips like how to insert a lifeline (very essential!) and how to size the headband for a perfect fit.

these headbands are great last-minute gifts, so knit them up for the holidays!

the headbands pictured are knit with one ball of rico essentials merino dk in the color brick red (79) and on skein of swans island washable wool sport in the color edgecomb grey

[click here for the free pattern & video tutorial][1]


  [1]: https://sheepandstitch.com/pattern/how-to-knit-a-twisted-headband-step-by-step-pattern/
